intro: Riedelia geluensis, commonly known as the Congo sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, white or yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocky substrates. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
